meanings.definition: To regard with disfavor or dislike.
meanings.sent1: She mislikes the taste of broccoli.
meanings.sent2: He mislikes cleaning his room on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The cat mislikes getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The old man mislikes change more than anything.
meanings.sent5: The teacher mislikes when students don't listen in class.

meanings.definition: A feeling of aversion or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: Her mislikes are clear when she wrinkles her nose.
meanings.sent2: His mislikes often stem from past experiences.
meanings.sent3: The mislikes of the group were taken into consideration.
meanings.sent4: The mislikes in the room were palpable during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The mislikes of the crowd could be heard in their murmurs.
